title: U.S. Treasury mulling offering new products including 50-year bonds
text: The U.S. Treasury said Wednesday it is exploring a range of new products, including an ultra-long bond. In a statement, the department said it is mulling issuing a 50-year bond and bringing back 20-year bonds. The department gave no timetable for any final decision. Treasury said it is also considering a one-year SOFR-linked floating rate note. SOFR, or the the Secured Overnight Financial Rate, is an alternative to the U.S. dollar London interbank offered rate (Libor). The Treasury has not sold 20-year bonds since 1986.
